CatDescriptText: Beatrice Lloyd, housewife, 2063 Bentley Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "I prefer a graduated income tax over an increase in the state sales tax.  That way we would have a better chance of getting a refund at the end of the year if we did not earn enough money to pay the tax."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bernice Lloyd wearing dark boucle coat with six buttons and light colored head scarf, standing in front of Bud Saunders Flowers in Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
